JobFullDesc:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
At American Express, we know that with the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. Whether we’re supporting our customers’ financial confidence to move ahead, taking commerce to new heights, or encouraging people to explore the world, our colleagues are constantly redefining what’s possible — and we’re proud to back each other every step of the way. When you join #TeamAmex, you become part of a diverse community of over 60,000 colleagues, all with a common goal to deliver an exceptional customer experience every day. 
The Sr Data Engineer leads the evaulation of next generation data technologies to enable continually evolving stringent requirements driven by multiple US and internationl data directives.
 
Lead the development of next generation data architecture for regulatory risk and finance capabilities, that scales across critical business considerations, such as multiple international markets, varying regulatory requirements, with security and governance considerations.
 
May have people leadership responsibilities.
 
Responsible for:
The rapid development of prototypes, quick evaluation of critical factors, under strict non-negotiable timelines such as regulatory deadlines. orms transformation of logical data architectures into physical data designs, according to database design best practices and standards.
 
Debugging database components, identifies, fixes and verifies remediation of design and/or performance defects.
 
Performs ongoing refactoring of database design and continuously improves product to follow data placement procedures.
 
Ensure optimal data replication, performance, High Availability, backup and recovery processes exists to meet requirements, reduce cost and adhere to standards 
At least 12 years of experience:
- In development large scale data programs with enterprise wide scope
- Deep expertise in Amex data systems, architectures, a plus
- Deep subject matter knowledge in risk data domain, a significant plus
 
Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.”
